title: K-12 Integrated Language Learning (Vocabulary, Grammar, Reading) E-Learning Course Development Strategy Using Heuristic Task Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic e-learning development processes and instructional design theories, foundational knowledge of language learning assessment techniques (grammar, vocabulary, expressive skills, pronunciation), and comprehension of text analysis and pragmatic approaches
context.additional_context: A real-time collaborative and project-development environment utilizing learners' personal devices (BYOD). It employs cloud-based platforms for sharing language learning content and supports the enhancement of expression and comprehension skills through peer feedback exchanges.

learning_goals: Improvement in strategic planning capabilities for language learning e-learning courses by applying HTA techniques (integrated vocabulary, grammar, reading, listening, and speaking design, with enhanced text analysis).

Learners will document and present a process of iterative improvement (at least three cycles) in a corporate language education project, including learner analysis (collecting 10 requirement surveys), content development (creating three thematic modules), and assessment design (two formative + one summative evaluations), submitting a project completion report (including writing/speaking assessments with added evaluation criteria for expressiveness, pronunciation, and communication skills).

Derivation and application of at least three customized heuristic principles based on institutional contexts (reflecting culture-specific language use patterns, analyzing regional idiomatic expressions and pragmatic features).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
